author: kfogel
msg: Follow up to r21169, fixing an embarrassing oversight:
(write_entry): Write out full length of depth value.

author: kfogel
msg: Use human-readable depth names in .svn/entries for now, to ease
development.  When the feature is complete, we can decide whether
or not to go back to the shorter names.
(read_entry): Look for "depth-zero" and "depth-one", and continue to
assume that anything other value must be svn_depth_infinity.

author: kfogel
msg: Doc change that should have been committed in r21167, for obvious reasons.

author: kfogel
msg: Revert r21067, that is, go back to the depth names introduced in r21035.
After working with both the original WebDAV names and the new LDAP
names for a while, I found it difficult to think with the LDAP names,
and kept wanting to use the WebDAV ones.  IMHO this is not because of
familiarity, but rather because the LDAP names are subtly misleading,
whereas the WebDAV names don't get in the way of their own meanings.
See also Max's mail, which I now agree with:
Subject: Objection to change in svn_depth_t component naming (r21067)
And the thread following from it:
